00001 /* Matthew Hammer <hammer@tti-c.org> */
00002 #if SLIME_HASH_BITS != 64
00003 #error "This shouldn't be included."
00004 #endif
00005 
00006 /*
00007   Note: These macros in this file were taken from Bob Jenkin's (public
00008   domain) C code:
00009 
00010   -- http://burtleburtle.net/bob/c/lookup8.c (64-bit)
00011 */
00012 
00013 /*
00014 --------------------------------------------------------------------
00015 mix -- mix 3 64-bit values reversibly.
00016 mix() takes 48 machine instructions, but only 24 cycles on a superscalar
00017   machine (like Intel's new MMX architecture).  It requires 4 64-bit
00018   registers for 4::2 parallelism.
00019 All 1-bit deltas, all 2-bit deltas, all deltas composed of top bits of
00020   (a,b,c), and all deltas of bottom bits were tested.  All deltas were
00021   tested both on random keys and on keys that were nearly all zero.
00022   These deltas all cause every bit of c to change between 1/3 and 2/3
00023   of the time (well, only 113/400 to 287/400 of the time for some
00024   2-bit delta).  These deltas all cause at least 80 bits to change
00025   among (a,b,c) when the mix is run either forward or backward (yes it
00026   is reversible).
00027 This implies that a hash using mix64 has no funnels.  There may be
00028   characteristics with 3-bit deltas or bigger, I didn't test for
00029   those.
00030 --------------------------------------------------------------------
00031 */
00032 #define mix(a,b,c) \
00033 { \
00034   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>43); \
00035   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<9); \
00036   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>8); \
00037   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>38); \
00038   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<23); \
00039   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>5); \
00040   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>35); \
00041   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<49); \
00042   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>11); \
00043   a -= b; a -= c; a ^= (c>>12); \
00044   b -= c; b -= a; b ^= (a<<18); \
00045   c -= a; c -= b; c ^= (b>>22); \
00046 }
Generated on Thu Mar 5 14:27:55 2009 for CEAL by  1.5.6
